Class PS3Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • PS3Controller

  • public class PS3Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    PS3Remote Class is suppose to act similar to the KeyListener but much simpler (i hope) it uses Jinput api (so yes you need to have the api) Website tutorial get the ipa into eclipse (or other) - http://goo.gl/kOWfCw NOTE this assumes the remote exist in the machine but it does not throw an error To use this you need to make an instance of this class in the instance it takes an int representing the player call isPressed to check if button is pressed call joystick to get the value of the x or y of left or right analog stick the values that represent the buttons are already made so no need to figure out which is which (that is if you are using a ps3 remote) THINGS THAT SHOULD BE ADDED add the ability to use the rumbler (might not be possible since i don't get any rumblers) needs to fix if the remote doesn't exist (add an exception or something) needs to add something to avoid repetition of remote THINGS ADDED (assumes remote does exist!) Analog Values for L and R joystick (each have their x and y) added ability to have more than one remote (NEEDS TO BE TESTED)
    Author:
    josuerojas

    • Method Detail

      • isPressed

        public boolean isPressed(int key)
        this method return true or false if the button is pressed
        Parameters:
        key - is the int position of the button usually used w/ PS3Remote.(button) ex. isPressed(PS3Remote.SELECT);
        Returns:
        true or false if the key is pressed or false if its analog

      • joystick

        public float joystick(int axis)
        this method finds the value for x or y on the left or right joystick
        Parameters:
        axis - the part of the joystick (x or y on left or right)
        Returns:
        the value of that part
